articles.title: Conference of Chairpersons of Primary Party Committees to Be Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Chairpersons of Primary Committees of WPK to Be Held
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the chairpersons of the primary committees of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) will be held in Pyongyang late in December, Juche 105 (2016).
					 The Central Committee of the WPK decided to convene a meeting of the chairpersons of the primary committees of the WPK with special importance being attached to the position and role of the primary party organizations in strengthening the party and building a powerful socialist country.
					
					 The meeting will give a great impetus to the drive of the army and people of the DPRK to strengthen the WPK into the great Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Party and carry to completion the cause of the Juche revolution started on Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Greetings to King of Bahrain
articles.content:
Greetings to King of Bahrain
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Friday sent a message of greetings to Hamad Bin Isa al-Khalifa, king of Bahrain, on its 55th national day.
					 Kim in the message wished good health and happiness to the king and prosperity to his country.

articles.title: Congratulations to Speaker of Kuwaiti National Assembly
articles.content:
Congratulations to Speaker of Kuwaiti National Assembly
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Marzouq Ali Al Ghanim on his reelection as speaker of the Kuwaiti National Assembly.
					 The message wished him success in his work, expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries and two assemblies would continue to develop in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.
					
					 On the same day, Foreign Minister of the DPRK Ri Yong Ho sent a congratulatory message to Sabah Al Khalid Al Hamad Al Sabah on his reappointment as first deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Kuwait.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean Business Persons in China Arrives
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean Business Persons in China Arrives
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Association of Korean Business Persons in China led by Chairman Phyo Song Ryong arrived here Friday to commemorate the fifth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Earlier, arriving was a delegation of the Association for Economic and Cultural Exchange of Korean Nationality in Dandong City of China headed by Chairman Kim Thaek Ryong.

articles.title: Chinese Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Chinese Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Family members of Zhang Wei-hua, a Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, and Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Bao-zhong, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, Friday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill here on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.
					 They placed floral baskets before the statues and paid tribute to the great leaders.
					
					 On the same day, a delegation of the Association for Economic and Cultural Exchange of Korean Nationality in Dandong City of China laid a basket of flowers at the statues.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to Statues of Great Leaders from Abroad
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to Statues of Great Leaders from Abroad
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Foreign organizations and personages and overseas compatriots sent floral baskets to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill here to commemorate the 5th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.
					 They are the Swiss Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu, the Nagano Prefectural People's Council of Japan for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, the Miyagi Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association, the Japan-Korea Society for Scientific and Educational Interchange, Yuwen Middle School in Jilin of China, Kim Jong Il Class in (Gor King－Erdene) Institute of Teachers of Mongolia, Ibrahim Mantu, chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association, Abudulah Adamu, a senator of Nigeria, the principal of Yuwen Middle School in Jilin, the family of Kim Chol, a Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr in China, and Jong Il Sim, widow of DPRK Hero An Tong Su. 
					
					 The floral baskets were placed at the statues on Friday.

articles.title: Remembrance Meeting of Youth and Students
articles.content:
Remembrance Meeting of Youth and Students
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting of youth and students "We Will Go on and on along the Road of Loyalty" took place at the Central Youth Hall on Friday, ahead of the fifth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 A narrative poem and chorus "His Life" was first put on the stage and all performers represented the revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il, who performed undying feats for the country and the revolution, the times and history, touching the heartstrings of the audience.
					
					 They sang high praises of the feats of Kim Jong Il who had trained the Korean youth to be reliable successors to the Juche revolution stoutly carrying forward the lineage of Paektu.
					
					 They truthfully represented the history of love shown by the great leaders for the young generation being given steady continuity by supreme leader Kim Jong Un who is taking care of the destiny of all people.
					
					 The performers vowed to work hard for the rosy future of a youth power, rallied closer around supreme leader Kim Jong Un, holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem forever.
					
					 Present at the meeting were Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league, officials concerned, officials of the youth league and those who had the honor of being received by the great leaders and persons related to their revolutionary activities and youth and students.

articles.title: Stamps Issued to Observe 5th Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
Stamps Issued to Observe 5th Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued new stamps (two sheets) to commemorate the fifth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Seen on the upper part of the stamps are letters reading "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be with us."
					
					 One stamp carries a benevolent image of Kim Jong Il standing against Mt. Paektu with a bright smile on his face. It makes one recall the revolutionary career of him who dedicated all his life to the country and the people.
					
					 Kimjongilia and magnolias in full bloom depicted on its lower part reflect the Korean army and people's ardent reverence for him as well as their strong will to hold him in high esteem as the sun of Juche Korea for all ages.
					
					 Another stamp shows Kim Jong Il among workers and officials, who indicated the orientation and ways for further developing the independent national economy, associated with the whole life of President Kim Il Sung, to meet the demands of the IT era, the era of knowledge-based economy.

articles.title: 90 Millions of Saplings Produced at Central Nursery
articles.content:
90 Millions of Saplings Produced at Central Nursery
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Central Nursery under the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection of the DPRK is one of the leading sapling producers, which is associated with the great feats leader Kim Jong Il performed for afforesting the country.
					 Kim Jong Il visited the nursery in October Juche 100 (2011), the last year of his life, and called for handing down to the coming generation the beautiful homeland which is thickly wooded and alive with all sorts of flowers.
					
					 True to his call, the nursery has produced over 90 millions saplings of over 180 species in the past five years to send them to nurseries and forestry stations throughout the country.
					
					 This year alone, the nursery raised more than 29.6 millions saplings of tens of species, including Larix lepolepis and Pinus rigida.
					
					 It sent nearly 50 000 Pinus strobes saplings to 50-odd units and 395 000 saplings of good species to the flood-hit northern parts of the country.
					
					 The nursery cleared scores of hectares of land for sapling cultivation, where sprayers and sunshades are installed, and built a scientific research room fully equipped with modern facilities.
					
					 It succeeded in establishing a method for planting trees in summer and made achievements in acclimatizing beech.
					
					 Meanwhile, the nursery has carried on regular consultation with nurseries in every province, city and county through video conferencing system.
					
					 Its Manager Ri Yong Sik told KCNA that officials and employees of the nursery will make positive contribution to increasing the forest resources of the country by further upgrading it.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams Senior Japanese Diplomat's Provocative Remarks
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams Senior Japanese Diplomat's Provocative Remarks
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Japan has gone the lengths of crying out for "attack" on the DPRK. 
					 Shortly ago, a senior official of the Foreign Ministry of Japan blustered that Japan "can attack the DPRK," pursuant to the "right to collective self-defense", if the south Korean regime requests and a serious threat is posed on the stability of Japan, a revelation of an undisguised scenario for invading the DPRK. 
					
					 This is unpardonable bellicose outbursts let out by political dwarfs little short of puppies knowing no fear of a tiger.
					
					 In recent years, Japan has put spurs to its moves for turning itself into a military giant, challenging its legal position as the defeated nation banned from having not only the right to belligerency and the right to participate in a war but also a regular army. 
					
					 Japan expanded worldwide the sphere of the activities of the SDF, which had been limited to areas around its territory, through the revision of the "Japan-U.S. Defense Cooperation Guidelines" and the adoption of the "security legislation," etc. and has come to exercise the "right to collective self-defense" under the pretext of military support to "its allies".
					
					 Japan is making desperate efforts to develop and purchase the latest weapons and equipment as evidenced by its shaping of the biggest-ever defense budget for fiscal 2017 running into 5 100 billion yen. It is busy putting its air and naval forces on a modern and long-distance basis.
					
					 It has stepped up the SDF's advance into overseas after mapping out a military strategy for overseas attack by taking advantage of the U.S. "anti-terrorism war."
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that against this background the above-said senior official of the Japanese Foreign Ministry unhesitatingly trumpeted about "attack" on the DPRK. 
					
					 Japan may stage a comeback to Korea any time and the DPRK is the primary target of its attack. 
					
					 Japan is mulling invading Korea and advancing into the continent with it as its stepping-stone just as it did in the last century.
					
					 This reckless scenario of the Japanese reactionaries is, however, leading their country to destruction.
					
					 The strategic position of the DPRK has dramatically changed as it is a dignified politico-ideological power and a world military power possessed of tremendous nuclear deterrent.
					
					 It is tragedy that Japan is still seized with megalomania, failing to face up to the trend of the times, only to precipitate its doom.
					
					 It is quite natural for the overwhelming majority of Japanese to be strongly opposed to the exercise of the "right to collective self-defense" which may invite a disaster more horrible than that in the last century.
					
					 Staging a comeback to Korea is bound to lead to destruction.
					
					 The Japanese authorities would be well advised to cogitate about their foolish actions to be entailed by terrible disasters.

articles.title: Protest Staged outside U.S. Embassy in S. Korea
articles.content:
Protest Staged outside U.S. Embassy in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The "body of citizens for equal south Korea-U.S. relations", grouping inhabitants from all walks of life in south Korea, reportedly held a protest rally outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Dec. 13.
					 The speakers at the rally accused the U.S. of pressing on with THAAD deployment despite the "National Assembly's" passage of a motion calling for the impeachment of Park Geun Hye. 
					
					 They demanded that the U.S. cancel at once its plan for THAAD deployment harmful to peace on the Korean peninsula as urged by the south Korean people in candlelight action.
					
					 They also urged the U.S. to solve the issue of the peninsula through the resumption of the DPRK-U.S. dialogue, not sanctions and pressure.

articles.title: Court's Ruling on KCTU Chairman Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Court's Ruling on KCTU Chairman Protested in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Organizations of south Korea on Dec. 13 lodged a protest against the puppet court's inflicting a heavy sentence on the chairman of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) on charges of spearheading an all-out people's action last year, according to reports from Seoul.
					 That day the Seoul High Court held a final hearing on an appeal by the KCTU chairman and sentenced him to jail term and fine, claiming that "he directly and indirectly agitated collision with police." 
					
					 In this regard, the KCTU declared that it would launch another candlelight campaign for the release of all prisoners including its chairman.
					
					 The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society released a commentary in denunciation of the court's crackdown upon the above-said chairman.
					
					 The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, too, in its commentary protested against the judiciary authorities' unjust decision and demanded the prompt release of the KCTU chairman.

articles.title: Halt to Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Halt to Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of Trade Unions of south Korea, together with lawmakers from opposition parties, called a press conference at the "National Assembly" on Dec. 13 in demand of halt to the retrogressive revision of labor law and elimination of the forces following the "government" power, according to the online newspaper Jaju Sibo.
					 A press release was read out there.
					
					 The press release held that Hwang Kyo An and other officials who took the lead in pressing on with the retrogressive revision of the labor law, aimed to push trade unions, youth and workers to joblessness and layoff, should be ousted from all posts as they have executed the scandal-tainted core policies of the regime.
					
					 It urged the "temporary National Assembly" to start discussion on the retraction of retrogressively revised labor law and ouster of the scandal-tainted officials.

articles.title: Number of Jobless Young People Increases in S. Korea
articles.content:
Number of Jobless Young People Increases in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A south Korean online newspaper reported Wednesday that the rate of jobless young people in south Korea hit an all-time high in November.
					 According to the annual Nov. statistics of jobless rate, the rate among those from 15 to 29 years old went up higher than last year, the highest since 2003.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in China
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting of families of those related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle took place at the DPRK Embassy in Beijing Tuesday on the occasion of the fifth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present at the meeting were families of Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary veterans in China, Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyrs and Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and the DPRK ambassador and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 Yu Ming, a son of Li Zade, a Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary veteran in China, said that attending the remembrance meeting, he missed Kim Jong Il very much.
					
					 He was very glad to hear that Marshal Kim Jong Un was elected chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) at its Seventh Congress and chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK at the 4th Session of the 13th Supreme People's Assembly, Yu said, adding: We are convinced that he would lead the Korean revolution to a brilliant victory, true to the intention of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Families of Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle said that the demise of Kim Jong Il is a great loss to not only the Korean people but also them.
					
					 They stressed that the Korean people working miracles in the building of a socialist power under the guidance of Kim Jong Un would register bigger successes while smashing every move of the U.S. imperialists and their south Korean stooges.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed in Various Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed in Various Countries
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries dedicated special write-ups to the 5th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Dec. 5th issue of the DR Congolese newspaper L'Avenir carried a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il and allotted one whole page to articles under the title of "Idea and exploits of leader Kim Jong Il will remain forever" and subtitles of "Eternal leader of the Korean people" and "Kim Jong Un, great successor to the cause of Juche".
					
					 The newspaper noted that the idea and lines set forth by Kim Jong Il serve as the eternal banner illuminating the road ahead of the Korean people. It is his greatest exploit that he had firmly defended Korean-style socialism, it stressed.
					
					 The Dec. 3rd issue of Malaysia's Guang Ming Daily carried an article titled "Yearning grows deeper" illustrated with photos of Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Saying that as the days go by, the Korean people's yearning for Kim Jong Il who dedicated his whole life to the national prosperity and the people's happiness grows deeper, the daily introduced in detail his ideo-theoretical exploits and Songun revolutionary feats.
					
					 The December issue of the Bulgarian newspaper Iskra carried an article titled "Korea to be certainly reunified" illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Un to introduce the exploits Kim Jong Il performed in the cause of national reunification.
					
					 The Dec. 4th issue of Pakistan's Kuweta Daily Independent in an article titled "Great nationalist" praised the exploits of Kim Jong Il who averted a war on the Korean Peninsula under the unfurled banner of Songun and thus defended the destiny of the nation.

articles.title: Se convocara en Pyongyang la conferencia de presidentes del comite de organizacion de entidad del PTC
articles.content:
Se convocara en Pyongyang la conferencia de presidentes del comite de organizacion de entidad del PTC
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) --Tendra lugar en esta capital a segunda quincena de diciembre del 105(2016) de la Era Juche la conferencia de los presidentes del comite de organizacion de entidad del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					Dando importancia especial a la posicion y el papel de los comites de organizaciones de entidad del Partido en el fortalecimiento y desarrollo del Partido y la construccion de la potencia socialista, el Comite Central del PTC decidio convocar esta conferencia.
					
					La cita impulsara con dinamismo la lucha de nuestro ejercito y el pueblo para fortalecer y desarrollar el PTC como gran partido de Kimilsungismo-Kimjongilismo y llevar a cabo la causa revolucionaria del Juche, iniciada en el monte Paektu.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita fiesta nacional de Bahrein
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita fiesta nacional de Bahrein
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 16 un mensaje de felicitacion al rey de Bahrein, Hamad Bin Isa al-Khalifa, con motivo del 55o aniversario del Dia Nacional de ese Reino.
					En su misiva, el remitente deseo buena salud y felicidad al destinatario y la prosperidad a Bahrein.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente electo de Ghana
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente electo de Ghana
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 15 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente electo de la Republica de Ghana, Nana Akufo-Addo.
					En la misiva, el remitente extendio felicitaciones al destinatario quien asumio el importante cargo de presidente ganandose la confianza del pueblo en las recientes elecciones celebradas en el pais africano.
					
					Convencido de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran aun mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises, formulo votos por los exitos en las responsabilidades del destinatario por la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Jovenes y estudiantes coreanos recuerdan a Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Jovenes y estudiantes coreanos recuerdan a Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 5o aniversario del fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, tuvo lugar el dia 16 en la Casa Central de la Juventud la escena de recordacion de jovenes y estudiantes "Iremos por el unico camino de fidelidad". 
					En la escena, iniciada con la poesia y coro "Su vida", los ejecutantes recordaron con emocion la vida revolucionaria del gran Lider quien realizo inmortales hazanas ante la patria, la revolucion, la epoca y la historia.
					
					Ellos enumeraron las hazanas del Dirigente quien fortalecio y desarrollo la Union de la Juventud como organizacion de jovenes fieles infinitamente al Partido y el Lider y formo a los jovenes coreanos como fidedignos continuadores de la revolucion del Juche y del linaje del Paektu. 
					
					Y confesaron con emocion que gracias al Mariscal Kim Jong Un, continua invariablemente la historia de amor a futuras generaciones de los grandes Lideres. 
					
					Los interpretes expusieron las decisiones de enaltecer eternamente al Dirigente y marchar con vigor hacia el futuro radiante de la potencia juvenil uniendose firmemente en torno al Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion el primer secretario del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud, Jon Yong Nam, los funcionarios de la rama interesada y la Union de la Juventud, las personas que fueron recibidas por el Dirigente y las relacionadas con sus actividades y los jovenes y estudiantes.

articles.title: ACNC comenta acto verbal imprudente de reaccionarios japoneses
articles.content:
ACNC comenta acto verbal imprudente de reaccionarios japoneses
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Japon se atreve a hablar hasta del "ataque" a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Hace poco, un funcionario del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de ese pais expuso abiertamente el intento de agredir a la RPDC, al decir que Japon puede hacerlo si se presenta la peticion de los titeres surcoreanos o una grave amenaza para la estabilidad del pais.
					
					Es un discurso belicoso de los politicos enanos que actuan como cachorro recien nacido que no conoce lo temible que es el tigre.
					
					En los ultimos anos, Japon da acicate a la conversion en potencia militar desafiando a su estado legal de pais derrotado en la guerra que no tiene derecho a la beligerancia y a la participacion en guerra ni a la posesion de fuerzas armadas regulares.
					
					Mediante la enmienda de la "guia de cooperacion de defensa Japon-EE.UU." y la aprobacion de la "ley de seguridad", amplio a todo el mundo el teatro operacional de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa", limitado antes al contorno del archipielago japones, y puede ejercer hasta el "derecho a la autodefensa colectiva" bajo el pretexto de asistencia militar a los "aliados".
					
					Planea fijar en 5 billones 100 mil millones de ￥el presupuesto de defensa nacional para el ano fiscal 2017, cifra mas alta de la historia, y desarrolla y compra muchos armamentos sofisticados. Ademas, impulsa los proyectos para modernizar las fuerzas aereas y navales y darles largo alcance.
					
					En consonancia con la "guerra antiterrorista" de EE.UU., se trazo la estrategia militar para el ataque a ultramar y entro en etapa crucial el avance a ultramar de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa".
					
					En tales circunstancias, se ha escuchado en boca no de un funcionario de Defensa sino del MINREX la palabra tan atrevida como "ataque a Corea".
					
					La nueva agresion de Japon a Asia es una cuestion de tiempo y su primer blanco es la RPDC.
					
					Al igual que el siglo pasado, Japon trata de agredir a Corea y avanzar al continente tomandola como cabeza de puente.
					
					Con sus acciones imprudentes, los reaccionarios japoneses conducen al pais a la autodestruccion.
					
					Hoy dia, se ha cambiado la posicion estrategica de la RPDC que emergio como digna potencia ideo-politica y la militar de talla mundial que cuenta con poderoso disuasivo nuclear.
					
					Es natural que la abrumadora mayoria de los japoneses rechace el ejercicio del "derecho a la autodefensa" que causara desastres incomparables con los sufridos en el siglo pasado.
					
					Las autoridades japonesas deberan actuar con prudencia.
